meanings.definition: A person who plods along slowly and heavily.
meanings.sent1: The plodders in the race were determined to finish, even if it took them longer.
meanings.sent2: The group of plodders made their way up the hill, step by step.
meanings.sent3: The plodders in the marathon were so slow, they almost looked like they were walking backward!
meanings.sent4: The plodders in the office were like turtles, moving at their own pace.
meanings.sent5: The image of the plodders struggling up the mountain stayed with me for days.

meanings.definition: A group of people who plod along slowly and heavily.
meanings.sent1: The plodders in the park were chatting as they walked, enjoying the slow pace.
meanings.sent2: As the plodders made their way through the mud, their determination was evident.
meanings.sent3: The plodders in the line at the grocery store seemed to be in no rush at all.
meanings.sent4: The plodders in the crowd moved like a herd of elephants, steady and deliberate.
meanings.sent5: The sight of the plodders trudging through the snow was both amusing and endearing.
